Pre-Game Insights: Alperen Sengun and the Houston Rockets host Jayson Tatum and the Boston Celtics in non-conference play.
The Rockets have gone 12-5 at home and rank second in the Western Conference in team defense, giving up only 106.4 points while holding opponents to 43.9% shooting.
The Celtics are 12-3 on the road and rank eighth in the Eastern Conference with 25.8 assists per game led by Jayson Tatum averaging 5.6.
The Rockets are shooting 44.3% from the field this season, 1.2 percentage points lower than the 45.5% the Celtics allow to opponents.
The Celtics average 13.2 more points per game (119.6) than the Rockets give up to opponents (106.4).
Alperen Sengun is averaging 19.1 points, 10.7 rebounds, and 5.1 assists for the Rockets.
Jayson Tatum is scoring 28.5 points per game with 9.5 rebounds and 5.6 assists for the Celtics.

In their last 10 games, the Rockets are 7-3, averaging 111.5 points, 47.8 rebounds, 21.6 assists, 8.0 steals, and 4.9 blocks per game while shooting 45.8% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 105.8 points per game.

In their last 10 games, the Celtics are 6-4, averaging 118.3 points, 47.6 rebounds, 26.1 assists, 8.5 steals, and 5.3 blocks per game while shooting 47.1% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 105.2 points.
Injuries for the Rockets include Jae'Sean Tate (day to day, illness), Tari Eason (day to day, rest), and Jock Landale (day to day, knee).
Injuries for the Celtics include Kristaps Porzingis (day to day, ankle) and Jaylen Brown (day to day, shoulder).
